We also ordered two hot dogs thinking they would be pretty good since there is a whole section on the menu devoted to them.
Surprisingly nothing could be further from the truth.
Because of the delicate thin crust, take-out pies get soggy in their boxes.
Everything that happened was not even up to mediocre.
I am a 100 lb girl, had a glass of wine and a glass of beer prior to the dinner, and I was still HUNGRY after my visit to this place!
If you love seafood, you would love this place!
The last time I went we were seated at a table in a corridor next to the kitchen.
My six year old loved it.
I had been searching really hard for a restaurant in New York where I could really feel unwanted and ignored and I finally found it!

By far this is the only chinese desserts place I know in NY or anywhere close in the Northeastern America that serves desserts with frog jelly in a couple of varieties and pig feet ginger simmered in black vinegar.
The decor is vibrant and eye-pleasing with several semi-private boths on the right side of the dining hall, which are great for a date.
I've had to wait only a few times during lunch but this place is definitely worth the wait.
Filled with suits, though, so you never really feel terribly comfortable.
They are served with a free appetizer and the portions are perfect for lunch.
Note that they do not serve beer, you must bring your own.
Faan is sooo good.
less wait time for me!
They are located in the middle of Chinatown!
Skip this location and go to the one in Soho.
It's not mind-blowing, but to me, thai food never is and never will be.
The takeout is great too since they give high quality tupperware as well.
